name: GetTeamMemberships
description:
Retrieve compact team membership records from Asana.

Fetches compact records of team memberships from Asana when scope 'team_memberships:read' is required.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to return per page. Must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: An offset token for pagination. Use a previously returned token to access subsequent pages. If omitted, the first page is returned.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the team in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. Use 'me', an email, or a user gid. Must be used with 'workspace'.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user. This parameter must be used with the workspace parameter.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace. This parameter must be used with the user_id parameter.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the workspace. This parameter must be used with the user parameter.

parameters.name: optional_fields_to_include
parameters.description: List the properties to include in the response, as some are excluded by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Return response in a readable format with line breaks and indentation. Ideal for debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:

An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the team.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user. This parameter must be used with the workspace parameter.
